Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Di:
Based on the information provided, Item 7A of the document focuses on both quantitative and qualitative disclosures about market risk. The quantitative disclosures primarily involve interest rate and foreign currency risk management. The company regularly reviews its foreign exchange forward and option positions, as well as interest rate swaps, to manage these risks. However, there is a level of uncertainty as these positions may not fully offset the financial impact of movements in foreign exchange or interest rates. The timing of gains and losses related to these instruments may also not coincide with the underlying economic exposures, potentially affecting the company's financial condition and operating results.

On the other hand, the qualitative aspects disclosed about market risk include the Company's regular review of foreign exchange forward and option positions, as well as interest rate swaps, both independently and in relation to underlying exposures. The document also mentions the uncertainty of risk management activities and the potential impact on the Company's financial condition and operating results. Factors affecting the Company's financial condition and operating results, such as interest rate and foreign currency fluctuations, are also highlighted as qualitative disclosures about market risk.

For further details or clarification, you can refer to page 28 of the Form 10-K document for [Company Name].

item to which the hedge relates on a str:
The changes in the fair value of amounts excluded from the hedge-related item are recognized in Other Comprehensive Income (OCI) on a straight-line basis over the life of the hedge. This accounting treatment applies to both net investment hedges and fair value hedges. In net investment hedges, the excluded amounts are included in the cumulative translation adjustment in OCI. In fair value hedges, the excluded amounts are recognized in Other Income and Expenses (OI&E) on a straight-line basis over the duration of the hedge. This gradual recognition ensures that the impact of these excluded amounts is spread out over the period of the hedge.

(Apple Inc. | 2020 Form 10-K | Page 43 and Page 5)

Item 11. Executive Compensation:
Based on the information provided, details on the executive compensation structure can be found under the heading "Executive Compensation" in Apple Inc.'s 2021 Proxy Statement. This document will be filed with the SEC within 120 days after September 26, 2020. The Executive Compensation section will cover aspects such as board oversight of risk management, compensation committee interlocks and insider participation, compensation of directors, and director compensation for the year 2020. For more specific details on the executive compensation packages, you can refer to the mentioned sections in the Proxy Statement document.

If you wish to delve deeper into how Apple Inc. determines and evaluates executive compensation, you can also explore methods like Total Shareholder Return (TSR), Restricted Stock Units (RSUs), and Share-Based Compensation. TSR is calculated based on different price differentials, RSUs are granted based on weighted-average grant date fair value, and Share-Based Compensation is determined by the company's common stock closing price on the grant date. The company recognizes expense on a straight-line basis for its equity awards. For a comprehensive understanding, you can also refer to the Benefit Plans section of Apple Inc.'s financial statements.

For more detailed information, you can access Apple Inc.'s 2020 Form 10-K, specifically on page 36. 

Reference: Apple Inc. | 2020 Form 10-K | Page 36
